properties.name: Babette Schwartz
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch 421 University Ave., 92103An entertaining, fun store located in Hillcrest, San Diego with toys, books and many unique items.

properties.name: Bookshop Santa Cruz
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch1520 Pacific Ave. Santa Cruz, CA 95060

properties.name: Brushstrokes
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch1510 Piedmont Ave, N.E. Atlanta, GA 30324A one-stop shop for gays and lesbians, Brushstrokes offers everything from pride paraphernalia to gay porn to novelties, gifts, cards, stationery, and T-shirts.

properties.name: Does Your Mother Know
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch4141 18th St. San Francisco, CA 94114This small Castro stationary store showcases bawdy cards for every occasion. You\'ll find gay-themed invitations, thank-you cards and 3-D birthday greetings, along with calendars, key chains, refrigerator magnets and more.

properties.name: EVENTS
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch 1966 West Gray, Houston, TX 77019Events is more than just a gift boutique, it is a complete sensory experience. Whatever your gift giving need, Events has something for you. From stationery and invitations to that perfect place setting, pamper yourself with the Events Experience. Events is located at 1966 West Gray in the River Oaks Shopping Center in Houston, Texas. The closest major intersection is Shepherd and West Gray

properties.name: Gift Basket Boutique
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch121 S. Kentucky Ave. Lakeland, FL 33801Located in the wonderful Downtown Lakeland Historical District, our store is surrounded by other great shopping and dining spots. Come downtown and spend the day! We have many unique and wonderful gifts for the discerning shopper. Please come visit, after all it\'s a fun place to shop!

properties.name: Kards Unlimited
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch5522 Walnut St. 15232The merchandise is fine, funky, flirty and fun, a combination you won\'t find at your ordinary card store chain.

properties.name: Miss Scarletts
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch617 W Willoughby Ave, Juneau, AK

properties.name: Mongrel
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch2924 W. Cary St. 23221Even if you don\'t have any gifts to buy, Mongrel is the type of store that pulls you inside just because your mind needs to play. The double-store space spills over with sassy cards, flamboyant gifts and some of the strangest novelty items around--check out its unusual array of string lights and the selection of oddball soaps.

properties.name: Motley
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch 623 Tremont Street, Boston, MA 02118 Motley is a fun, cute store in the South End. Think Black Ink with silly t-shirts. It\'s great for little stocking stuffer type gifts. The owner is super fun to chat with.

properties.name: Moule
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch443 Academy Rd, WinnipegUltra chic boutique carries the latest fashions, giftware, home accents, books, toys and beauty products. Fashions by Betsey Johnson, Dirty Laundry, Seven and Chip & Pepper Jeans. Also bags, shoes and luggage by Philippe Starck.

properties.name: Mr. Moons
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch316 Center St Healdsburg, CA 95448Mr. Moon\'s in Healdsburg could be called a "gift shop." But where a gift shop might stock porcelain figurines of gingham-clad piggies smooching each others\' snouts, Mr. Moon\'s is so much better. I like the collection of ethnic jewelry, which is entirely unique and not outrageously expensive. Perhaps I can best describe Mr. Moon\'s by describing what was in my shopping basket during a recent visit: a Where the Wild Things Are retro-looking T-shirt; carved black bone earrings; an African Odyssey Putumayo CD; a pink leather wallet (embroidered with straw flowers); and a pale blue-and-white mother-of-pearl necklace that looks like a large domino on a leather cord. Healdsburg girls out on the town eyeballing each other\'s accessories commonly return the invariable compliment "Cute [insert item of clothing, jewelry or miscellaneous tchotchke here]!" with the invariable smile and response: "Mr. Moon\'s." It all awaits at 316 Center St., Healdsburg. 707.433.6666.--E.L.

properties.name: Mxyplyzyk
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch125 Greenwich Ave. New York, NY 10014The perfect party store, and one that will get you in the mood to purchase a show off item for your home, Mxyplyzyk specializes in defying categorization and always having something brand new that you have never seen. They stock lighting, clocks, bathroom hardware, luggage, dinnerware, toys, barware, phones, mats and much more at every price point you can imagine (though most prices are smaller than a breadbox).

properties.name: Obelisk-The Book Store
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch1029 University Ave. San Diego, CA 92103Phone: (619) 297-4171

properties.name: Object
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch177 West St. Annapolis, MD 21401

properties.name: PULP
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch1803 14th St., NW 20009 We see ourselves as a community center, where people feel acknowledged, respected, and entertained. We give often to local charities, schools and non-profits, sponsor a local softball team, and participate in various community celebrations. Our staff and merchandise celebrate diversity and we love both goofy and “edgy” cards and gifts as well as beautifully hand-made paper and gift items with cutting-edge design. The Kuumba Room, the separate third floor space at our Hill store, has hosted art exhibits, focus groups, fundraisers, poetry readings, yoga classes and is a space available to local non-profit organizations.

properties.name: PULP on the Hill
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch303 Pennsylvania Ave. SE 20003The store has lots of funky, cute gifts, wrapping paper, stationery, and the like. Be sure to visit the neighboring stores, which share the cool aesthetic.

properties.name: Paper Doll
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch231 W. Charleston Blvd. Suite 130, Las Vegas, NV 89012Las Vegas\' most unique paper store and gift boutique that specializes in the city\'s most beautiful selection of letter press, silk screened and hand-made note cards. Open Tue-Sat 10.30am to 6pm. First Friday until 10pm. (702) 385-7892

properties.name: Paper Skyscraper
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch330 East Blvd Charlotte, NC 28203A not-so-serious store that appeals to your visual senses, featuring well-designed objects ranging from cards, gifts, bath and body items, candles, stationery, journals to lamps and occasional tables. In Charlotte\'s Dilworth neighborhood at the corner of East Boulevard and Euclid Ave. Hours: Mon-Fri: 10am to 7pm Saturday: 10am - 6pm Sunday: Noon to 5pm

properties.name: Paper Trail
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch5309 N. Clark St. 60640"This is a great card store for people with whimsical and irreverent taste. I really enjoy browsing through all the cards, tissue paper and cute gifty things. I think of it as a one-stop shop if you haven\'t bought a present because they carry books, stationery, photo albums, cigarette cases and collectibles. Visit Paper Trail in Andersonville if you are looking for something special for an edgy friend or family member.

properties.name: Party on La Cienega
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch 350 South La Cienega Blvd. 90048The newly expanded store (across the street from the Beverly Center) is a treasure trove of party supplies and ideas. If you already know exactly what your party is going to look like, then all you have to do is go to Party On to pick up the goodies. They have all the streamers and balloons and decorations you can imagine, and all at perfectly reasonable prices. If you still have no idea what kind of theme you want for your party, but you know you want to have one, Party On can help you there, too. A mere visit to the store can be an inspiring sight to behold. You will gather so many ideas while there, that we guarantee you’ll be planning parties for the rest of the year as you are walking out the door. In addition to party supplies, Party On carries some of the most eclectic and interesting gift ideas around. So whether you are hosting a party or going to one, you will not be left empty-handed. Party On La Cienega is located at 350 South La Cienega Boulevard. Call 310-659-8717.

properties.name: Phil's BBQ
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch 4030 Goldfinch St, San Diego, 92103Phil\'s BBQ is by far one of the best barbeque joints in the country. Hyperbole? Then I challenge you to try this place. Any time of the day when their doors are open, there\'s a line.

properties.name: Pineapple Post
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch2403 S. 3rd St., Jacksonville Beach, FL 32250We are a full-service gift and home accessories shop, noted for our old-fashioned customer service and Southern hospitality. Located in the Costa Verde Plaza in Jacksonville Beach, Florida for 30 years, we invite you to visit our store or shop with us through our website.

properties.name: Pulp
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch425 S. La Brea Ave. 90036Extremely high-end, homemade, one-of-a-kind cards created by local artists will cost you about to apiece. You get what you pay for, though. These cards are luscious and made with truly lovely materials (often lace, silk, thick paper, even cubic zirconium). You wouldn’t want to buy your holiday cards here in bulk, though. Best for rare, extremely special or once-in-a-lifetime occasions – your best friend’s wedding or a 10-year anniversary, say – Pulp’s products are made for hanging up on a bookshelf or even framing on your wall as a work of art.

properties.name: Pumpkinseeds
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch1 N. Main St. Lexington, VA 24450Fanciful finds for the body, home, & garden. April Cornell clothing, and Red Fish bags, M-Sa 10am-5:30pm.

properties.name: Red Marq
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch308 PArk avenue South, 32789(407) 647-2336 308 S Park Ave Winter Park, FL 32789

properties.name: Signed Sealed Delivered
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch1726 Grand Ave., Billings, MT 59102

properties.name: Silver Spider
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch117 1/2 First St. W, Mount Vernon, IA 52314fun jewelry, Frames and gifts from New York City

properties.name: Small Joys
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitchcourt road, bedford village, 10506While browsing in Bedford, do not miss Small Joys. The most frequently overheard comment is - "I want everything". There are gifts for bride, baby, home and you - all carefully selected. Tucked away on Court Road, it\'s definitely worth a visit. Phone: (914)-234-9738. Open Mon-Sat 9:30-5:00

properties.name: Swish Flowers
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch14225 23rd Ave Nw Edmonton, AB High-Quality and Creativity Go Hand-in-Hand Located on the Southside of Edmonton is one of the city’s funkiest flower shops. Swish Flowers specializes in high-quality custom arrangements and creative concepts. Inside the store you’ll find a colourful array of fresh cut flowers and a wide selection of unique gifts. The store is not afraid to show off its creative side with its deep-orange painted walls.

properties.name: TANSU
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch321-B West 19th St. Houston, TX 77008Like a forbidden city, Tansu offers an escape from the bustle of city life. Add Japanese calm to the home with clean, simple furniture pieces and accessories, or stay a little longer for a two-hour workshop and learn origami. (713) 880-5100

properties.name: The Forecast
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch 218 Seventh St. SE Washington, DC 20003Located in Southeast Washington, The Forecast can assist you in finding the perfect gift for someone special or your own indulgence. This exquisite store is well known for its excellent personal service. The Forecast provides a varied collection of clothing, accessories, and gift items. If you are looking for something a little different and of excellent quality, visit this lovely store.

properties.name: The Original Paper-Ya
properties.description: Posted by CerebralitchGranville Island’s paper palace is home to stationary, photo albums, journals, cards, as well as 1000 different sheets of handmade and decorative paper from around the world.

properties.name: The Write Image
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch2205 E. 2100 South, Salt Lake City, UT 84109

properties.name: Therapy
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch545 Valencia St San Francisco, CA 94110Pink elephant dish towels, ribbon-ready Dirty Girl soap, nifty Paul Frank wallets, chunky jewelry and 1960s Russian poster books--this neighborhood-appropriate gift store in the Mission has something for everyone and even sells the bacon-covered wrapping paper to put it in. A fine selection of clothes and purses from big-name brands and local designers along with shoes for kittens rounds out the browser-friendly shelves.

properties.name: Two Neat
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch111 Throckmorton Ave. Mill Valley, CA 94941

properties.name: Virtual Images Salon
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch104 Portola Rd. Portola Valley, CA 94028Neighborhood salon with a very cool vibe

properties.name: Wishbone
properties.description: Posted by Cerebralitch601 Irving Street, San Francisco CA The Scene Wishbone is the sort of store that beckons even if you aren\'t in the mood to shop. Owners Gay Lam and Cory Vilano consider their irresistibly cute store a modern-day "dime store," which is why you\'ll find a wall of candy near the card section, and silly ribbons that exclaim "I\'m a Big Girl" next to the candles and bath soaps. The Goods Filled with hip, urban goodies like adorable Paul Frank wallets, pricey Kate Spade day planners and Doggie Diner T-shirts, this little house of style caters to a funky, accessory-savvy crowd. Lam and Vilano handpick an array of eclectic items, and encourage shoppers to purchase knickknacks they never knew they needed. If you\'re not careful, you\'ll walk away with an alluring set of mushroom-shaped salt and pepper shakers.
